Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")

Docs.summary: Provides text for a object. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextViewElement> class supports the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextView> by breaking the text property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextView> object into logical elements. Each element is then used by the pagination mechanism of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextView> object. It is this class that the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextView> mobile control uses to ensure that page breaks do not occur in the midst of links or other elements that should not be divided between pages.
If you want to derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextView> mobile control or are creating a new adapter, you will likely be able to use this class without modification.

Docs.permission: for operating in a hosted environment. Demand value: ; Permission value: .

MemberSignature.Value: public bool BreakAfter { get; }
.property instance bool BreakAfter
Public ReadOnly Property BreakAfter As Boolean
public: property bool BreakAfter { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Sets or returns a property that determines whether an additional trailing break is rendered after the control. This break causes subsequent content to start on the next line. The default is . This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: if an additional trailing break is rendered after the control; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is ignored by controls for which a trailing break is not appropriate. The following table lists the controls that support the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.BreakAfter%2A> property for certain kinds of devices.
|Control|Device With HTML Browser|Device With WML Browser|Device with WML/UP Browser| |-------------|------------------------------|-----------------------------|---------------------------------| |AdRotator|||| |Calendar|Y||| |Command|Y|Y|| |Image|Y|Y|Y| |Label|Y|Y|Y| |Link|Y|Y|| |List|||| |ObjectList|Y (unless device's browser can handle tables)||| |Panel (default is false)|Y|Y|Y| |PhoneCall|Y|Y|| |SelectionList|Y (Unless browser can handle tables)|Y|| |TextBox|Y|Y|| |TextView|Y|Y|| |TextViewElement|Y|Y|| |Validator|Y|Y|Y|

MemberSignature.Value: public string Text { get; }
.property instance string Text
Public ReadOnly Property Text As String
public: property System::String ^ Text { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Sets or returns the text for the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextViewElement.Text%2A> property can be specified by using the `Text` attribute, or as inner text. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextViewElement.Text%2A> property is specified in both ways, the inner text always takes precedence. However, if the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextViewElement.Text%2A> property is programmatically set, the inner text is automatically removed and the newly set property takes precedence.
